name: Ext.form.Basic
doc:
Provides input field management, validation, submission, and form loading services for the collection of Field instances within a Ext.container.Container. It is recommended that you use a Ext.form.Panel as the form container, as that has logic to automatically hook up an instance of Ext.form.Basic (plus other conveniences related to field configuration.)

Form Actions

The Basic class delegates the handling of form loads and submits to instances of Ext.form.action.Action. See the various Action implementations for specific details of each one's functionality, as well as the documentation for doAction which details the configuration options that can be specified in each action call.

The default submit Action is Ext.form.action.Submit, which uses an Ajax request to submit the form's values to a configured URL. To enable normal browser submission of an Ext form, use the standardSubmit config option.

File uploads

File uploads are not performed using normal 'Ajax' techniques; see the description for hasUpload for details. If you're using file uploads you should read the method description.

Example usage:

Ext.create('Ext.form.Panel', {
    title: 'Basic Form',
    renderTo: Ext.getBody(),
    bodyPadding: 5,
    width: 350,

    // Any configuration items here will be automatically passed along to
    // the Ext.form.Basic instance when it gets created.

    // The form will submit an AJAX request to this URL when submitted
    url: 'save-form.php',

    items: [{
        xtype: 'textfield',
        fieldLabel: 'Field',
        name: 'theField'
    }],

    buttons: [{
        text: 'Submit',
        handler: function() {
            // The getForm() method returns the Ext.form.Basic instance:
            var form = this.up('form').getForm();
            if (form.isValid()) {
                // Submit the Ajax request and handle the response
                form.submit({
                    success: function(form, action) {
                       Ext.Msg.alert('Success', action.result.message);
                    },
                    failure: function(form, action) {
                        Ext.Msg.alert('Failed', action.result ? action.result.message : 'No response');
                    }
                });
            }
        }
    }]
});

members.name: api
members.doc:
If specified, load and submit actions will be handled with DirectLoad and DirectSubmit. Methods which have been imported by Ext.direct.Manager can be specified here to load and submit forms. API methods may also be specified as strings. See Ext.data.proxy.Direct.directFn. Such as the following:

api: {
    load: App.ss.MyProfile.load,
    submit: App.ss.MyProfile.submit
}

Load actions can use paramOrder or paramsAsHash to customize how the load method is invoked. Submit actions will always use a standard form submit. The formHandler configuration (see Ext.direct.RemotingProvider#action) must be set on the associated server-side method which has been imported by Ext.direct.Manager.
members.short_doc:
If specified, load and submit actions will be handled with DirectLoad
and DirectSubmit. ...

members.name: baseParams
members.doc:
Parameters to pass with all requests. e.g. baseParams: {id: '123', foo: 'bar'}.

Parameters are encoded as standard HTTP parameters using Ext.Object.toQueryString.
members.short_doc: Parameters to pass with all requests. ...

members.name: errorReader
members.doc:
An Ext.data.reader.Reader (e.g. Ext.data.reader.Xml) instance or configuration to be used to read field error messages returned from 'submit' actions. This is optional as there is built-in support for processing JSON responses.

The Records which provide messages for the invalid Fields must use the Field name (or id) as the Record ID, and must contain a field called 'msg' which contains the error message.

The errorReader does not have to be a full-blown implementation of a Reader. It simply needs to implement a read(xhr) function which returns an Array of Records in an object with the following structure:

{
    records: recordArray
}
members.short_doc: An Ext.data.reader.Reader (e.g. ...

members.name: jsonSubmit
members.doc: If set to true, the field values are sent as JSON in the request body. All of the field values, plus any additional params configured via baseParams and/or the options to submit, will be included in the values POSTed in the body of the request.
members.short_doc: If set to true, the field values are sent as JSON in the request body. ...

members.name: method
members.doc: The request method to use (GET or POST) for form actions if one isn't supplied in the action options.

members.name: paramOrder
members.doc:
A list of params to be executed server side. Only used for the api load configuration.

Specify the params in the order in which they must be executed on the server-side as either (1) an Array of String values, or (2) a String of params delimited by either whitespace, comma, or pipe. For example, any of the following would be acceptable:

paramOrder: ['param1','param2','param3']
paramOrder: 'param1 param2 param3'
paramOrder: 'param1,param2,param3'
paramOrder: 'param1|param2|param'
members.short_doc: A list of params to be executed server side. ...

members.name: paramsAsHash
members.doc: Only used for the api load configuration. If true, parameters will be sent as a single hash collection of named arguments. Providing a paramOrder nullifies this configuration.
members.short_doc: Only used for the api load configuration. ...

members.name: reader
members.doc: An Ext.data.reader.Reader (e.g. Ext.data.reader.Xml) instance or configuration to be used to read data when executing 'load' actions. This is optional as there is built-in support for processing JSON responses.
members.short_doc: An Ext.data.reader.Reader (e.g. ...

members.name: standardSubmit
members.doc: If set to true, a standard HTML form submit is used instead of a XHR (Ajax) style form submission. All of the field values, plus any additional params configured via baseParams and/or the options to submit, will be included in the values submitted in the form.
members.short_doc: If set to true, a standard HTML form submit is used instead of a XHR (Ajax) style form submission. ...

members.name: timeout
members.doc: Timeout for form actions in seconds.
members.short_doc: Timeout for form actions in seconds. ...

members.name: trackResetOnLoad
members.doc: If set to true, reset() resets to the last loaded or setValues() data instead of when the form was first created.
members.short_doc:
If set to true, reset() resets to the last loaded or setValues() data instead of
when the form was first created. ...

members.name: url
members.doc: The URL to use for form actions if one isn't supplied in the doAction options.

members.name: waitMsgTarget
members.doc: By default wait messages are displayed with Ext.MessageBox.wait. You can target a specific element by passing it or its id or mask the form itself by passing in true.
members.short_doc: By default wait messages are displayed with Ext.MessageBox.wait. ...

members.name: waitTitle
members.doc: The default title to show for the waiting message box
members.short_doc: The default title to show for the waiting message box ...

members.name: owner
members.doc: The container component to which this BasicForm is attached.

members.name: taskDelay
members.doc: Not a public API config, this is useful when we're unit testing so we can turn off the delayed tasks so they fire immediately.
members.short_doc:
Not a public API config, this is useful when we're unit testing so we can

params.doc: Configuration options. These are normally specified in the config to the Ext.form.Panel constructor, which passes them along to the BasicForm automatically.

members.name: doAction
members.doc: Performs a predefined action (an implementation of Ext.form.action.Action) to perform application- specific processing.

params.name: action
params.doc: The name of the predefined action type, or instance of Ext.form.action.Action to perform.

params.name: options
params.doc:
The options to pass to the Ext.form.action.Action that will get created, if the action argument is a String.

All of the config options listed below are supported by both the submit and load actions unless otherwise noted (custom actions could also accept other config options):

properties.name: url
properties.doc: The url for the action (defaults to the form's url.)

properties.name: method
properties.doc: The form method to use (defaults to the form's method, or POST if not defined)

properties.name: params
properties.doc:
The params to pass (defaults to the form's baseParams, or none if not defined)

Parameters are encoded as standard HTTP parameters using Ext.Object.toQueryString.

properties.name: headers
properties.doc: Request headers to set for the action.

properties.name: success
properties.doc: The callback that will be invoked after a successful response (see top of submit and load for a description of what constitutes a successful response).

properties.name: action
properties.doc:
The Action object which performed the operation. The action object contains these properties of interest:

  • response
  • result - interrogate for custom postprocessing
  • type

properties.name: failure
properties.doc: The callback that will be invoked after a failed transaction attempt.

properties.name: action
properties.doc:
The Action object which performed the operation. The action object contains these properties of interest:

  • failureType
  • response
  • result - interrogate for custom postprocessing
  • type

properties.name: scope
properties.doc: The scope in which to call the callback functions (The this reference for the callback functions).

properties.name: clientValidation
properties.doc: Submit Action only. Determines whether a Form's fields are validated in a final call to isValid prior to submission. Set to false to prevent this. If undefined, pre-submission field validation is performed.

members.short_doc:
Performs a predefined action (an implementation of Ext.form.action.Action) to perform application-
specific processing. ...

members.name: findField
members.doc: Find a specific Ext.form.field.Field in this form by id or name.

params.name: id
params.doc: The value to search for (specify either a id or name or hiddenName).

return.name: return
return.doc: The first matching field, or null if none was found.

members.short_doc: Find a specific Ext.form.field.Field in this form by id or name. ...

members.name: getBoundItems
members.doc: Finds and returns the set of all items bound to fields inside this form

return.name: return
return.doc: The set of all bound form field items

members.short_doc: Finds and returns the set of all items bound to fields inside this form ...

members.name: getFieldValues
members.doc: Retrieves the fields in the form as a set of key/value pairs, using their getModelData() method to collect the values. If multiple fields return values under the same name those values will be combined into an Array. This is similar to getValues except that this method collects type-specific data values (e.g. Date objects for date fields) while getValues returns only String values for submission.

params.name: dirtyOnly
params.doc: If true, only fields that are dirty will be included in the result.

members.short_doc:
Retrieves the fields in the form as a set of key/value pairs, using their
getModelData() method to collect the values. ...

members.name: getFields
members.doc: Return all the Ext.form.field.Field components in the owner container.
members.short_doc: Return all the Ext.form.field.Field components in the owner container. ...

members.name: getRecord
members.doc: Returns the last Ext.data.Model instance that was loaded via loadRecord
members.short_doc: Returns the last Ext.data.Model instance that was loaded via loadRecord ...

members.name: getValues
members.doc: Retrieves the fields in the form as a set of key/value pairs, using their getSubmitData() method to collect the values. If multiple fields return values under the same name those values will be combined into an Array. This is similar to getFieldValues except that this method collects only String values for submission, while getFieldValues collects type-specific data values (e.g. Date objects for date fields.)

params.name: asString
params.doc: If true, will return the key/value collection as a single URL-encoded param string.

params.name: dirtyOnly
params.doc: If true, only fields that are dirty will be included in the result.

params.name: includeEmptyText
params.doc: If true, the configured emptyText of empty fields will be used.

params.name: useDataValues
params.doc: If true, the getModelData method is used to retrieve values from fields, otherwise the getSubmitData method is used.

members.short_doc:
Retrieves the fields in the form as a set of key/value pairs, using their
getSubmitData() method to collect the values. ...

members.name: hasInvalidField
members.doc: Returns true if the form contains any invalid fields. No fields will be marked as invalid as a result of calling this; to trigger marking of fields use isValid instead.
members.short_doc: Returns true if the form contains any invalid fields. ...

members.name: hasUpload
members.doc:
Returns true if the form contains a file upload field. This is used to determine the method for submitting the form: File uploads are not performed using normal 'Ajax' techniques, that is they are not performed using XMLHttpRequests. Instead a hidden <form> element containing all the fields is created temporarily and submitted with its target set to refer to a dynamically generated, hidden <iframe> which is inserted into the document but removed after the return data has been gathered.

The server response is parsed by the browser to create the document for the IFRAME. If the server is using JSON to send the return object, then the Content-Type header should be set to "text/plain" in order to tell the browser to insert the text unchanged into a '<pre>' element in the document body from which it can be retrieved.

If the Content-Type header is sent as the default, "text/html", then characters which are significant to an HTML parser must be sent as HTML entities, so encode "<" as "<", "&" as "&" etc.

The response text is retrieved from the document, and a fake XMLHttpRequest object is created containing a responseText property in order to conform to the requirements of event handlers and callbacks.

Be aware that file upload packets are sent with the content type multipart/form and some server technologies (notably JEE) may require some custom processing in order to retrieve parameter names and parameter values from the packet content.
members.short_doc: Returns true if the form contains a file upload field. ...

members.name: initialize
members.doc: Do any post layout initialization
members.short_doc: Do any post layout initialization ...

members.name: isDirty
members.doc:
Returns true if any fields in this form have changed from their original values.

Note that if this BasicForm was configured with trackResetOnLoad then the Fields' original values are updated when the values are loaded by setValues or loadRecord. This means that:

  • trackResetOnLoad: false -> Will return true after calling this method.
  • trackResetOnLoad: true -> Will return false after calling this method.
members.short_doc: Returns true if any fields in this form have changed from their original values. ...

members.name: isValid
members.doc: Returns true if client-side validation on the form is successful. Any invalid fields will be marked as invalid. If you only want to determine overall form validity without marking anything, use hasInvalidField instead.
members.short_doc: Returns true if client-side validation on the form is successful. ...

members.name: load
members.doc: Shortcut to do a load action.

params.name: options
params.doc: The options to pass to the action (see doAction for details)

members.short_doc: Shortcut to do a load action. ...

members.name: loadRecord
members.doc:
Loads an Ext.data.Model into this form by calling setValues with the record data. The fields in the model are mapped to fields in the form by matching either the Ext.form.field.Base.name or Ext.Component.itemId.
See also trackResetOnLoad.
members.short_doc:
Loads an Ext.data.Model into this form by calling setValues with the
record data. ...

members.name: markInvalid
members.doc: Mark fields in this form invalid in bulk.

params.name: errors
params.doc: Either an array in the form [{id:'fieldId', msg:'The message'}, ...], an object hash of {id: msg, id2: msg2}, or a Ext.data.Errors object.

members.short_doc: Mark fields in this form invalid in bulk. ...

members.name: onFieldAdd
onFieldRemove
onMonitorInvalidate
onValidityChange
members.doc: Handle changes in the form's validity. If there are any sub components with formBind=true then they are enabled/disabled based on the new validity.
members.short_doc: Handle changes in the form's validity. ...

members.name: reset
members.doc: Resets all fields in this form. By default, any record bound by loadRecord will be retained.

params.name: resetRecord
params.doc: True to unbind any record set by loadRecord

members.short_doc: Resets all fields in this form. ...

members.name: setValues
members.doc: Set values for fields in this form in bulk.

params.name: values
params.doc:
Either an array in the form:

[{id:'clientName', value:'Fred. Olsen Lines'},
 {id:'portOfLoading', value:'FXT'},
 {id:'portOfDischarge', value:'OSL'} ]

or an object hash of the form:

{
    clientName: 'Fred. Olsen Lines',
    portOfLoading: 'FXT',
    portOfDischarge: 'OSL'
}

members.short_doc: Set values for fields in this form in bulk. ...

members.name: submit
members.doc:
Shortcut to do a submit action. This will use the AJAX submit action by default. If the standardSubmit config is enabled it will use a standard form element to submit, or if the api config is present it will use the Ext.direct.Direct submit action.

The following code:

myFormPanel.getForm().submit({
    clientValidation: true,
    url: 'updateConsignment.php',
    params: {
        newStatus: 'delivered'
    },
    success: function(form, action) {
       Ext.Msg.alert('Success', action.result.msg);
    },
    failure: function(form, action) {
        switch (action.failureType) {
            case Ext.form.action.Action.CLIENT_INVALID:
                Ext.Msg.alert('Failure', 'Form fields may not be submitted with invalid values');
                break;
            case Ext.form.action.Action.CONNECT_FAILURE:
                Ext.Msg.alert('Failure', 'Ajax communication failed');
                break;
            case Ext.form.action.Action.SERVER_INVALID:
               Ext.Msg.alert('Failure', action.result.msg);
       }
    }
});

would process the following server response for a successful submission:

{
    "success":true, // note this is Boolean, not string
    "msg":"Consignment updated"
}

and the following server response for a failed submission:

{
    "success":false, // note this is Boolean, not string
    "msg":"You do not have permission to perform this operation"
}

params.name: options
params.doc: The options to pass to the action (see doAction for details).

members.short_doc: Shortcut to do a submit action. ...

members.name: updateRecord
members.doc: Persists the values in this form into the passed Ext.data.Model object in a beginEdit/endEdit block. If the record is not specified, it will attempt to update (if it exists) the record provided to loadRecord.
members.short_doc: Persists the values in this form into the passed Ext.data.Model object in a beginEdit/endEdit block. ...

members.name: actioncomplete
members.doc: Fires when an action is completed.
members.short_doc: Fires when an action is completed. ...

members.name: actionfailed
members.doc: Fires when an action fails.
members.short_doc: Fires when an action fails. ...

members.name: beforeaction
members.doc: Fires before any action is performed. Return false to cancel the action.
members.short_doc: Fires before any action is performed. ...

members.name: dirtychange
members.doc: Fires when the dirty state of the entire form changes.

params.name: dirty
params.doc: true if the form is now dirty, false if it is no longer dirty.

members.short_doc: Fires when the dirty state of the entire form changes. ...

members.name: validitychange
members.doc: Fires when the validity of the entire form changes.

params.name: valid
params.doc: true if the form is now valid, false if it is now invalid.

members.short_doc: Fires when the validity of the entire form changes. ...
